page.title: 01Area-Achavanich Caithness
page.content: This flat area of moorland in central cathness cptures the unique quality of the county. The landscape, treeless and barren is unlike any other part of the north of Scotland it is difficult in this area to make a living from farming, but agriculture is themain industry in this part of Britain. Achavanich the main farm covers 529 acres and has been farmed by the Mackay family for almost a century. The land offers mainly rough graz/ing for cattle and sheep, but some cultivation around the dwelling houses has taken palce. The aea is rich in peat,which is harvsted annually for fuel by those in the area. There are no amenities,b ut the farm is a focal point for those travelling in the county. The remoteness of this area would be hard for a city dweller to comprehend.
